body:
<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
Despite having:
```
kubectl get cm -n rook-ceph  rook-config-override  -o json | jq -r .data.config
[global]
osd max backfills = 16
osd recovery max active = 4
```
osd config-init doesn't put values into a config used by osd:

```
2019-10-09 06:38:02.947368 I | cephosd: Config file /var/lib/rook/osd0/rook-ceph.config:
[global]
fsid                         = ce7e6343-947e-4b0b-86ad-dbc996bd5d99
mon initial members          = d a b
mon host                     = 172.20.175.9:6789,172.20.189.18:6789,172.20.159.5:6789
log file                     = /dev/stderr
mon cluster log file         = /dev/stderr
public addr                  = 172.16.0.8
cluster addr                 = 172.16.0.8
mon keyvaluedb               = rocksdb
mon_allow_pool_delete        = true
mon_max_pg_per_osd           = 1000
debug default                = 0
debug rados                  = 0
debug mon                    = 0
debug osd                    = 0
debug bluestore              = 0
debug filestore              = 0
debug journal                = 0
debug leveldb                = 0
filestore_omap_backend       = rocksdb
osd pg bits                  = 11
osd pgp bits                 = 11
osd pool default size        = 1
osd pool default min size    = 1
osd pool default pg num      = 100
osd pool default pgp num     = 100
osd max object name len      = 256
osd max object namespace len = 64
osd objectstore              = filestore
crush location               = root=default host=ii-k8s-worker02-int-na-intgdc-com
rbd_default_features         = 3
fatal signal handlers        = false

[osd.0]
keyring          = /var/lib/rook/osd0/keyring
osd journal size = 5120
```
Generated deployment for pod have:
```
    "name": "ROOK_CEPH_CONFIG_OVERRIDE",
    "value": "/etc/rook/config/override.conf"
```
but override values are written to /etc/ceph/ceph.conf

/etc/rook/config/override.conf doesn't exist
**Expected behavior:**
values from rook-config-override are injected to osds

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
This is a pretty standard ceph block cluster with filestore

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

 To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
Read [Github documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS 7.7
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: openstack
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.1.2
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): 1.13.6
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.15.4
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): private
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
title: rook-config-override still not injected in 1.1.2
